definition: Richard Nixon (1913-1994), US president 1969-1974/surname Nixon
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
abbr. for 克羅地亞|克罗地亚[Ke4 luo2 di4 ya4], Croatia/(Tw) abbr. for 克羅埃西亞|克罗埃西亚[Ke4 luo2 ai1 xi1 ya4], Croatia
pine/CL:棵[ke1]
surname Song

sentences.english: I conveyed Nixon's crucial decision to Dinitz.
sentences.chinese: 我向迪尼茨轉達了尼克松關鍵性的決定。

sentences.english: Following Nixon's visit to China, the Chinese team came to the United States.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松訪華後，中國乒乓球隊回訪了美國。

sentences.english: Fuck Nixon, I'm sure we can do better.
sentences.chinese: 操尼克松，我相信我們能做得更好。

sentences.english: It has been used repeatedly in history, not least by former U.S. President Richard Nixon.
sentences.chinese: 歷史上不乏先例，美國前總統尼克松就是其中之一。

sentences.english: The President Richard Nixon's crumpling up has illustrated the power of the media lively.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松總統的垮臺，形象地說明了新聞報道的威力。

sentences.english: In Nixon's tenure, the United States held three Soviet summit.
sentences.chinese: 在尼克松任期內，美蘇共舉行了三次首腦會晤。

sentences.english: She typed an e-mail to Nixon, who came right away.
sentences.chinese: 她給尼克松發了一封電子郵件，他很快就來了。

sentences.english: Nixon built a one-lane bowling alley below the driveway leading to the North Portico.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松在通向北門廊的行車道下方修了一條保齡球道。

sentences.english: The risk does not detract from nixon's courage in running it .
sentences.chinese: 危險無損於尼克松甘冒風險的勇氣。

sentences.english: So Nixon gave them each a White House brooch.
sentences.chinese: 然後，尼克松就送了他們每人一個白宮胸針。

sentences.english: Nixon winces when Hatchett's words are repeated to him.
sentences.chinese: 當尼克松多次聽到哈契特的話時他退縮了。

sentences.english: Gillian Anderson and Cynthia Nixon guest star.
sentences.chinese: 吉莉安安德森和辛西婭尼克松客串。

sentences.english: The relationship between Nixon and Agnew illustrated these maxims .
sentences.chinese: 尼克松和阿格紐之間的關係就是這些準則的證明。

sentences.english: Nixon suffered from a cold and bad makeup.
sentences.chinese: 而尼克松由於死板而糟糕的化妝而吃了虧。

sentences.english: The relationship between Nixon and Agnew illustrated these maxims.
sentences.chinese: 尼克松和阿格紐之間的關係就是這些準則的證明。
尼克松的工資和價格監管方案未能奏效。

definition: Clinton (name)/Bill Clinton (1946-), US Democratic politician, President 1993-2001/Hillary Rodham Clinton (1947-), US Democratic politician
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
Henry Kissinger (1923-), US academic and politician, Secretary of State 1973-1977
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
Roosevelt (name)/Theodore Roosevelt (1858-1919), US President 1901-1909/Franklin D. Roosevelt (1882-1945), US President 1933-1945
Tanaka Kakuei (1918-1993), Japanese politician, prime minister 1972-1974
Mrs Thatcher/Baroness Thatcher or Margaret Thatcher (1925-2013), British conservative politician, prime minister 1979-1990
Leonid Brezhnev (1906-1982), Soviet statesman, General Secretary of the Communist Party of the USSR 1966-1982
Yeltsin (name)/Boris Yeltsin (1931-2007) first post-communist president of Russia 1991-1999
Watergate scandal
president (of a country)/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4],名[ming2],屆|届[jie4]
Brzezinski (name)/Zbigniew Brzezinski (1928-2017), Polish-American academic and politician, US National Security Adviser 1977-1981
Atchison or Acheson (name)/Atchison city on Missouri in Kansas, USA
Deng Xiaoping (1904-1997), Chinese communist leader, de facto leader of PRC 1978-1990 and creator of "socialism with Chinese characteristics"
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator
